title: Introducing: Evening Man
body:
I’m finding it really difficult to pin my finger on exactly what it is that I like so much about Washington’s **Evening Man** aka Paul Erik Lipp.

His newest release In Space is a myriad of twisted synths, outlandishly auto-tuned vocals and pop songwriting worthy of a diploma. Eccentric and at times slightly abrasive, the nine tracks that comprise the release are each individually tailored to perspire a differing section of Lipp’s personality. Be it the 80’s squelchy tenebrosity of _In Movies_ or the screeched line _“But that doesn’t mean I won’t stay here anyway._” unearthed in _Glass Beneath The Skin_, **Evening Man** is the music of a collection of a vulnerable yet cock-sure musician.

Sonically, the vocals bring up memories of **Elbow’s** Guy Garvey  whilst the instrumentation is part **Duran Duran**, part **Depeche Mode**, as it swings between menacing and luxuriously upbeat. My personal highlight, the soundtrack worthy I Can’t Be Your Man finds it’s roots amongst folk-pop yet spreads his branches into the far more exciting and emotionally unstable realms. _The way you stand there in the light, like I never could have found you. _  
_You could evaporate in night. You know I’m gonna have to…_ Check out the full release below, and keep up with **Evening Man** via [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/pages/Evening-Man/196187513741468?ref=ts&fref=ts).
